hero.srTitle: Federico Roma – Muay Thai and Kickboxing World Champion

about.title: About Me
about.description:
I’m Federico Roma, former world champion in Muay Thai and Kickboxing. With over 20 years of experience, I trained at the Escuela de Campeones Dojo Serpiente and in training camps across Thailand. I’ve competed in countries such as Uruguay, Peru, Mexico, France, Poland, Japan, Thailand, and Indonesia.

As a coach, I’ve worked with both amateur and professional fighters, representing Argentina in international events like Glory Kickboxing, RISE (Japan), and WGP. I’ve trained champions across multiple disciplines, and I also offer personalized classes, where I teach the art with the same passion — helping my students reach goals like weight loss, improved technique, and greater confidence.
about.videoSubtitle: Path to the world title and technical TV interview

earlySteps.title: My early steps in sports
earlySteps.p1: I was always very athletic. I was always doing something: running, jumping, playing. At 5 years old, I started playing tennis. I couldn’t even get the ball over the net and dragged my racket around, but I wanted to hit every ball. What started casually ended up lasting 10 years.
earlySteps.p2: One day, while I was training, I stepped on a ball I didn’t see. I fell backwards and landed all my weight on one leg. I fractured my tibia. It was a serious fracture, and I spent six months in a cast. But the next day, I still went to train in a wheelchair, cast and all. The coaches were incredibly patient with me.

infancyDiscipline.title: My childhood: discipline, movies and martial arts
infancyDiscipline.p1: At 13 I started Karate, and between 15 and 16 I did a bit of Aikido. At that time, I was very immersed in traditional martial arts. At 18 I started boxing, and within a few months I was hooked on kickboxing.
infancyDiscipline.p2: My parents always emphasized the academic path. I was studying Computer Engineering, and they thought that was my destiny. I was always good with computers, I liked it. But the passion I felt while training was something else.
infancyDiscipline.p3: Since I was a kid I’ve been a fan of martial arts movies. I watched them all: Van Damme, Steven Seagal, Bruce Lee… I used to binge-watch them on Sundays at noon.

christianBosch.title: Cristian Bosch and the dojo that shaped my journey
christianBosch.p1: I still remember the old dojo at Club Argentina in Castelar. It was in 2003 when I started training with Cristian Bosch. I wanted to improve and never missed a class. I saw him as a great role model.
christianBosch.p2: Before every class I would start stretching at home, doing sit-ups. I arrived early. Once I was allowed, I would stay after class and keep training, kicking the bags on my own.

firstFight.title: My first fight, my first fire
firstFight.p1: My first fight was a mix of emotions: anxiety, nerves, adrenaline. I was warming up and Cristian showed me my opponent. He took out a black belt from his bag. I looked at it and it said: '4th Dan Karate'. I was a green belt in kickboxing.
firstFight.p2: I thought: this guy is dangerous. He had tremendous kicks. If he landed one clean, who knows what would’ve happened. It was a tough fight. But I managed to win on points. When it ended, I said to myself: I want more of this.
firstFight.p3: I felt something amazing in the progress. Every day something improved: my punches, my kicks, my movement. My teammates also helped me, gave me tips. I was always good at listening and applying.
firstFight.p4: I had just a few amateur fights when Cristian proposed a match in Uruguay. It was going to be my first professional fight.

lossAndStrength.title: The pain that pushed me to become stronger
lossAndStrength.p1: One of the hardest moments in my life was when my father passed away. I had been competing for a few years, and he passed from pancreatic cancer. It was a huge blow. That’s when I had to choose: let myself fall, or transform that pain.
lossAndStrength.p2: I gathered strength. My dad always taught me to move forward. Giving up was not an option.
lossAndStrength.p3: Since then, I always travel with two amulets: one photo of him and one of my grandfather, my Nono. They’re always with me. They give me strength, they protect me.
lossAndStrength.p4: For me, WKN was the ultimate goal. I followed the rankings online, looked at all the world and European champions. I dreamed of being there someday, even if it felt far away.

dojoToWorld.title: From Dojo Serpiente to the world's biggest stages
dojoToWorld.p0: For me, WKN was the ultimate. I followed all the rankings online, watched the world and European champions. I dreamed of being there someday, even if it felt far away.
dojoToWorld.p1: After a lot of effort, training, and fights, I got the opportunity: a very tough match against Tomas Tadlanek, European champion. It was for the WKN Intercontinental Muay Thai title.
dojoToWorld.p2: I wasn’t the favorite. But I trained like never before. I focused, I prepared, and gave it my all.
dojoToWorld.p3: I won by KO in the 4th round. It was a victory I’ll never forget.
dojoToWorld.p4: Thanks to that victory, I got the chance to fight for the world title against Tomasz Makowski. He was already a huge name — 9-time world champion, and had beaten all the best. For me, it was a massive opportunity to fulfill a dream: to be ranked by the WKN.
dojoToWorld.p5: The trip was incredibly long, with countless layovers. We left Buenos Aires and only arrived at the final destination in Poland after many, many hours.
dojoToWorld.p6: Tomaz was the clear favorite. But I wanted that belt. I wanted to win and be a world champion. I knew it was going to be a brutal fight. Cristian always believed in me. Together, we crafted a strategy — and everything went perfectly.
dojoToWorld.p7: Cristian told me: “Throw four strong low kicks and then start letting go.” I couldn’t take big risks at the beginning. I stepped forward, wore him down little by little. By the third round, he started feeling my punches. I slowly broke him down.
dojoToWorld.p8:
In the fourth round, he fell… and couldn’t get back up.

I WAS WORLD CHAMPION!
dojoToWorld.p9: That title meant so much to me. Winning it was incredibly powerful. I had never felt anything like it. It was one of the most intense emotions of my life.

shareMission.title: Today, my mission is to share what I’ve learned
shareMission.p1: As a coach, I work with both amateur and professional athletes and have been part of the technical team for Argentine national selections. I’ve been present at high-level events like Glory Kickboxing, R.I.S.E. (Japan), WGP and international Muay Thai tournaments organized by IFMA. My focus is always on achieving both group objectives and the individual goals of each fighter.
shareMission.p2: I offer personalized classes for all types of people, from those who want to deeply study the art, to those who want to improve their fitness, lose weight, or simply train with purpose.
shareMission.p3: I’m an ontological coach, boxing coach and personal trainer. This allows me to guide physical transformation processes with a holistic approach: technical, physical and mental.
shareMission.p4: I also offer sports coaching and seminars, as well as training for teams, gyms or groups interested in high performance.

careerPath.title: My professional journey
careerPath.p1: I trained at the Escuela de Campeones Dojo Serpiente with Cristian 'Serpiente' Bosch, and I also trained in Thailand, the birthplace of Muay Thai. Throughout my career I represented Argentina in international events in Japan, France, Poland, Indonesia, Mexico, Peru, Paraguay, Uruguay and more.
careerPath.p2: I was one of the first Argentinians to compete in ONE Championship and RISE, making a mark in national sports. As a coach, I joined technical teams of national selections, worked with amateur and professional athletes, and participated in high-level events such as Glory, IFMA and WGP.

claudio.title: Amateur World Champion
claudio.text: I want to thank Fede Roma for his support on my path toward athletic goals. His guidance has helped me achieve personal milestones and improve my physical condition. Thanks for the constant motivation and support. I'm happy to keep working toward more goals. The change in my body weight has been remarkable, and I feel stronger. Thank you, Fede, for believing in me.

franco.title: World Champion
franco.text:
It wasn’t easy… it never was. But here I am. I carried silence, doubts, and wounds no one saw. I fell many times — some so hard I thought I wouldn’t get up again. But I always did. Not out of pride, but necessity.

I fought alone many times. No applause, no witnesses. And in every fall, in every dark night, I became stronger. I learned to trust myself, to hold on when everything seemed to fall apart.

Today I’m not invincible, but I’m brave. Because I keep going despite the pain, the fear, and the times I doubted. Because I chose not to be defeated, and that defines me.

My story isn’t perfect, but it’s true. And if my journey can give strength to someone who’s on the ground today, then it was all worth it.

florencia.title: National Kickboxing Champion
florencia.text:
Training with Fede and fighting under his guidance was the best thing that happened to me in my sports career. He taught me what discipline means, how to trust in myself, to work for what I want, and not to give up in the face of adversity.

I must say I was — and still am — privileged to have someone like him guide me in my journey and place his trust in me. He’s an excellent person!

elizondo.title: Instructor of Kickboxing
elizondo.text: Forever grateful to Fede Roma, who believed in me from the very beginning and supported me in every way to help me reach both athletic and personal goals. Today, I’m a semi-professional fighter, instructor, and black belt in kickboxing. I also founded our own Dojo Serpiente branch in the city of Salto, Buenos Aires. Thank you for everything, Fede.

irioni.title: Professional Fighter · Argentine Champion
irioni.text: Fede Roma, my great coach — or 'el Shuper', as I call him. He was a turning point in both my athletic and personal life. Thanks to him, I am who I am today. I was able to fulfill many dreams because he was my coach, including one of the biggest: working at Dojo Serpiente, one of the most important in the world. His humility, patience, and above all, his love for teaching made me believe that I can achieve anything I set my mind to.

nofri.title: Instructor of Kickboxing
nofri.text: Fede was one of the best people — if not the best — that I’ve met in this sport, both professionally and personally. He guided me toward my athletic goals, helping with both physical and technical preparation. I’m truly thankful to Fede for believing in me and giving me a real opportunity.

gustavo.title: Instructor of Kickboxing
gustavo.text: Fede Roma was one of the most important people who guided me on this beautiful path of combat sports. He believed in me and my teammates when we were just starting out. I'm from Salto, a small town in the province of Buenos Aires, where opportunities aren’t always the same. But he supported us and shared his knowledge so we could train and be part of his team. Today, I’m a kickboxing instructor, graduated from one of the top martial arts academies — Dojo Serpiente. A dream come true. That’s why, to honor everything he’s done and continues to do for us, our school is named after him: 'Esc. Federico Roma'. Today, it has over 60 students, many of whom are already competing at a very good level. Thank you, Fede! We keep progressing thanks to his guidance — even from a distance, he’s always communicating and offering advice for every situation and training. A great person with strong values and a true role model!

delfina.title: Fighter and Kickboxing Instructor
delfina.text: Fede was a key part of my personal and athletic growth. Thanks to his guidance and dedication, I achieved many of my goals. But the most valuable thing he taught me was to believe in myself and develop a sense of confidence I didn’t have before. I’m deeply grateful for everything he helped me build — both in and out of the ring.

bordi.title: Instructor of Kickboxing
bordi.text: I had the honor of having Fede as a teacher and guide — someone who truly marked a before and after in my journey as an athlete. He helped me improve in many areas that I now pass on to my own students. Infinitely grateful.

macbeth.title: Instructor of Kickboxing
macbeth.text: I can only express gratitude toward Fede. He’s a true champion in every sense of the word. Behind that fierce competitor who always gives his all in epic fights, there’s a great person with tremendous humility. I’ve learned so much from Fede — he’s always willing to help, guide and advise me on this journey. Thanks to him, I’m where I am today: running a Dojo Serpiente branch in Paraná. I’ll always be grateful and wish him the very best.
